thread.title: PMQs: Corbyn and Cameron clash over tax credits
thread.title_full: PMQs: Corbyn and Cameron clash over tax credits - BBC News

author: BBC
title: PMQs: Corbyn and Cameron clash over tax credits
text:
PMQs: Corbyn and Cameron clash over tax credits 14 October 2015 From the section UK Politics Jeremy Corbyn has challenged David Cameron over tax credit cuts and affordable housing in his second Prime Minister's Questions appearance.
The Labour leader repeated his PMQs tactic of asking questions submitted by the public, saying he had received 2,000 emails about tax credits.
He said the government was "limiting the life chances" of hundreds of thousands of children.
The PM said the new National Living Wage was making people better off.
He pointed to increased employment rates and accused Labour of "borrowing money forever", attacking its change in policy towards the government's fiscal charter ahead of a vote later.
